posts.content:
Had an issue today with the van. After travelling for 40 mins she Just died, and wouldn't restart. Luckily we pulled into an empty car park.

It is possible that my fuel gauge is playing up so we got a can of petrol. petrol in and it was trying to start, the odd time it would try and catch, but never run.

whilst I was troubleshooting I noticed the earth strap was warm, not hot. But then it was 30-40 mins since we stopped.

The copper connector was corroded (green). So I took it off and put on a spare (yes I was carrying one). It started , and I did 150 further miles with no issues.

My question is - Would the earth strap getting hot reduce the connection voltage so much that it wouldn't get a good enough spark? Are the symptoms I experienced in line with this diagnosis?

I will obviously give it a good going over tomorrow, is there anything else I should / could do? I seem to remember my grandad putting grease /petroleum jelly on his battery connectors, was this to stop the corrosion?
